english.title: Long-term visa.
english.description: A long-term visa for France, also known as a "visa de long s√©jour," is a type of visa that allows individuals to stay in France for an extended period beyond the typical short-term tourist visa duration.

steps.title: Determine the type of visa you need.
steps.description: Identify the category of long-term visa that suits your purpose of travel to France. This could include a work visa, student visa, family reunion visa, or other relevant visa category.
steps.question: Do you know wich type of visa you need?

steps.title: Prepare the necessary documents - passport.
steps.description: You will need a valid passport, it must be valid for at least three months beyond your planned date of departure.
steps.question: Do you have a valid passport?

steps.title: Prepare the necessary documents - Visa application form.
steps.description: You will need to complete a visa application form. You can download the form from the website https://france-visas.gouv.fr/en/web/france-visas/forms.
steps.question: Do you have a complete visa application form?

steps.title: Prepare the necessary documents - Photos.
steps.description: You will need to provide two passport photos. The photos must be recent, in color, and measure 3.5 cm x 4.5 cm. The photos must be taken against a white background.
steps.question: Do you have two recent passport photos?

steps.title: Prepare the necessary documents - Proof of accommodation.
steps.description: You will need to provide proof of accommodation. This could include a hotel reservation, a rental agreement, or a letter of invitation from your host in France.
steps.question: Do you have proof of accommodation?

steps.title: Prepare the necessary documents - Proof of financial means.
steps.description: You will need to provide proof of financial means. This could include bank statements, pay slips, or other relevant documents.
steps.question: Do you have proof of financial means?

steps.title: Prepare the necessary documents - Proof of travel insurance.
steps.description: You will need to provide proof of travel insurance. The insurance must cover the entire duration of your stay in France.
steps.question: Do you have proof of travel insurance?

steps.title: Prepare the necessary documents - Purpose-specific documents.
steps.description:
Work visa: Employment contract, letter from the employer, work permit, and proof of professional qualifications.
Student visa: Acceptance letter from a recognized educational institution, proof of payment of tuition fees, and academic transcripts.
Family reunion visa: Proof of family relationship, such as marriage or birth certificates, and a letter of invitation from the family member residing in France.
steps.question: Do you have purpose-specific documents? (Work visa, student visa, family reunion visa, or other relevant visa category)

steps.title: Schedule an appointment.
steps.description: You will need to submit your application in person at the French embassy or consulate in your country of residence. You will need to pay the visa fee when you submit your application. Remember to bring all the necessary documents with you to your appointment.
steps.question: Have you submitted your application?

steps.title: Collect your visa.
steps.description: You will need to collect your visa from the French embassy or consulate in your country of residence. You will need to present your passport and visa fee receipt when you collect your visa.
steps.question: Have you collected your visa yet?
